text: Yo. George Lynch pwns face. But still chubby. :thumbsup:

name: saddestking
text:
The above comment will be found by archaeologists in 3,000 A.D. who discover the internet as the last remnant of our society.

They will smoke a cigarette, re-read the comment one last time, turn off the computer, put a mercy bullet in its heart, and tell lies about "a society where information was free and all men were scholars."

name: boredom_man
text:
I, Boredom Man, wish to have your suicidal babies.

(Is that the saddest, or second-saddest thing? Discuss.)

name: zapatos
text: I was babysitting this kid, poured him a bath and went downstairs to play video games.  He DROWNED himself man, so... its so selfish.

name: lizjones
text: PRESS

name: xud
text: oh man panel 4 did me in.  Right in the middle of a meeting with my laptop. I had to leave.

name: shmuckeles
text: oh man, tell me about it. i was all crying and shit. that indignant "Hey!". i still laugh about it

name: sp1derbaby
text: I laughed hard. Then stopped. Then started again. Then tried to stop. Then I hid in the toilet for a while and returned to my desk, trying to regather some dignity.

name: aliiis
text: What happened was, I too read this at work (in my lunch hour), and laughed. And then quickly had to think about something else to stop laughing. And then when I got home just now thought 'I will look up that comic again and have a proper good old laugh', and actually the thought of it made me start laughing before I had even opened up my web browser to do so. All just sitting there laughing at my laptop's start up screen. Then I had to explain it to my boyfriend. So it goes.

name: dusty
text: My old Taurus had a sticker on it about how war is never necessary or some such thing,four times some asshat left a note on my car in a parking lot responding to it. It wasn't even my sticker. My cars windshield is not a message board. I can only Imagine some Pat in whoever would make such a reply.

name: qingofchina
text: I think the first 4 panels coulda been the whole comic

name: stayawaystars
text: oh, i dunno, the "problems in the community" bit is vital character development for our friend Philippe.

name: kledermans
text: He is, after all, running for President.  He's got an image to maintain.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Ohhh I totally forgot about that. Ah, in a way that kind of makes it less funny...

I mean, it's sort of better to imagine his worry about causing problems in the community just because... he's just worried about the community. Not because of his impending Presidency.

Still fucking great though.

name: dominus101
text: Philippe seemed less than interested in his presidential run in the last strip that referenced it. I think he is just worried about the community. Philippe doesn't strike me as politically savvy enough to be worried about it the other way. He is just a good (and special) boy.

name: sargasm
text: Can Todd read Philippe's mind?

name: shoinan
text: That or he was eavesdropping on the earlier conversation. And since dropping eaves is a mighty sin that young squirrel better have some Uri Geller going on.

name: moraiat
text: By sometime Todd means: "right now".

name: myrmidon101
text: Anyone else believe that Phillipe's car somehow resembles Bowser's flying machine thing ?

name: sirptom
text:
Has anyone noticed that Philippe's car is the same as Monkey Boy's in the comics that Onstad did for the Stanford Chaparral ?

It's a distinctive look.

text: You two dudes confuse the shit out of me. Lookit them avatars. Lookit them.

name: shoinan
text: Quite simply, if I was a huge fag, I'd get the "Here comes a huge fag" shirt. But I'm not, I'm a special boy, in every single sense, and as such I have that shirt. And I've already got a cat, thankyou.

name: achilleselbow
text: It would only get you some pussy if you live, work, or attend school in the kind of place where people wear messenger bags and listen to Xiu Xiu. I live in that kind of place. I think I will wear a 'huge fag' t-shirt.

name: zapatos
text: I paint my toenails a "frozen teal."  You know the story.

name: paperboy_2000
text:
Lyle has paired a single note from the horn with each word until he gives 'fag' a nice little flourish at the end.

I like to think that Todd's horn has the identical music.

name: mattylite
text: I have discovered, through careful research, that Todd's horn plays the same tune as Todd's open mic song.

name: ibetso
text: By panel 2, this one was already a 5 out of 5. By panel 4, it became infinity out of 5.

text: Thanks to this strip, when you search for my Achewood sticker'd cell phone with bluetooth, you will find 'A huge fag'.

name: tourach3
text: all i need is that van and some coke and i will be RUUUUDE as hell

name: sandswipe
text: I always pictured Phillipe's shoes and guitar playing a warm, friendly recording of his elderly mother saying "Here comes a special boy." I now picture the same exact motherly tone as his car's voice. Awesome.

name: achilleselbow
text:
I don't understand how Todd can make the comparison - his horn seems to be entirely accurate.

Also, Lyle seems to have gained some subtlety since the days where he would just punch Philippe in the stomach.

name: spinynorman
text: Or tell him to shove it, thus killing him.

text: It's not even a song, it's just Lyle yelling off-key.

text: The squirrel calls the otter, who is several times larger than him, "little guy."

name: eidolem
text: Going from the very beginning to now, this is my favourite favourite one.  I was going to qualify that by saying I can't picture Philippe knowing about "fag"--see Homosexuals, the Gorilla--but every five year old knows about "fag."  It's like genetic memory or some shit.

name: kikineko
text: I think I killed my spleen... the fourth panel is hilarious.  And I thought it might say: "Here comes a Special Boy!"  Also, Philippe's car is what I imagined to be like from a five-year-old's creative mind.

name: nofalsehero
text: This is the strip that got me reading Achewood regularly. It never gets old.
